title: The conditional operator for classes
content: This subsection introduces the conditional operator for classes, denoted by ` if ( ph , A , B ) ` (see ~ df-if ). It is the analogue for classes of the conditional operator for propositions, denoted by ` if- ( ph , ps , ch ) ` (see ~ df-ifp ).

blocks.name: cif
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the conditional operator for classes.
blocks.origin: prop class cif(class c0, class c1, wff w0) { if(w0, c0, c1) }

blocks.name: diff.cif.s
diff.cif.c
diff.cif.w
df-if
blocks.content: Definition of the conditional operator for classes. The expression ` if ( ph , A , B ) ` is read "if ` ph ` then ` A ` else ` B ` ". See ~ iftrue and ~ iffalse for its values. In the mathematical literature, this operator is rarely defined formally but is implicit in informal definitions such as "let f(x)=0 if x=0 and 1/x otherwise". An important use for us is in conjunction with the weak deduction theorem, which is described in the next section, beginning at ~ dedth . (Contributed by NM, 15-May-1999.)

blocks.name: dfif2
blocks.content: An alternate definition of the conditional operator ~ df-if with one fewer connectives (but probably less intuitive to understand). (Contributed by NM, 30-Jan-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfif2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wceq(cif(c0, c1, w0), cab(s0, wi(wi(wcel(cv(s0), c1), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  eqtri(cif(c0, c1, w0), cab(s0, wi(wi(wcel(cv(s0), c1), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0))), cab(s0, wo(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wn(w0)))))
  df-if(s0, c0, c1, w0)
  abbii(s0, wo(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wn(w0))), wi(wi(wcel(cv(s0), c1), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)))
  3bitr4i(wo(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wn(w0))), wi(wi(wcel(cv(s0), c1), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wo(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wn(w0)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), wi(wn(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wn(w0))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)))
  df-or(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wn(w0)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0))
  orcom(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wn(w0)))
  imbi1i(wi(wcel(cv(s0), c1), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0), wn(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wn(w0))))
  iman(wcel(cv(s0), c1), w0)
}

blocks.name: dfif6
blocks.content: An alternate definition of the conditional operator ~ df-if as a simple class abstraction. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: ifeq1
blocks.content: Equality theorem for conditional operator. (Contributed by NM, 1-Sep-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: ifeq2
blocks.content: Equality theorem for conditional operator. (Contributed by NM, 1-Sep-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: iftrue
blocks.content: Value of the conditional operator when its first argument is true. (Contributed by NM, 15-May-1999.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 26-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: iftruei
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ iftrue . (Contributed by BJ, 7-Oct-2018.)

blocks.name: iftrued
blocks.content: Value of the conditional operator when its first argument is true. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: iffalse
blocks.content: Value of the conditional operator when its first argument is false. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-1999.)

blocks.name: iffalsei
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ iffalse . (Contributed by BJ, 7-Oct-2018.)

blocks.name: iffalsed
blocks.content: Value of the conditional operator when its first argument is false. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: ifnefalse
blocks.content: When values are unequal, but an "if" condition checks if they are equal, then the "false" branch results. This is a simple utility to provide a slight shortening and simplification of proofs versus applying ~ iffalse directly in this case. It happens, e.g., in ~ oevn0 . (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 15-May-2015.)

blocks.name: ifsb
blocks.content: Distribute a function over an if-clause. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Aug-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm ifsb(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wceq(c0, cif(c1, c2, w0))
  -| wi(wceq(cif(c3, c4, w0), c3), wceq(c0, c1))
  -| wi(wceq(cif(c3, c4, w0), c4), wceq(c0, c2))
} = {
  pm2.61i(wceq(c0, cif(c1, c2, w0)), w0)
  eqtr4d(c0, cif(c1, c2, w0), c1, w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cif(c3, c4, w0), c3))
  iftrue(c3, c4, w0)
  iftrue(c1, c2, w0)
  eqtr4d(c0, cif(c1, c2, w0), c2, wn(w0))
  syl(wn(w0), wceq(c0, c2), wceq(cif(c3, c4, w0), c4))
  iffalse(c3, c4, w0)
  iffalse(c1, c2, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ifsb(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ⊢ c0 = if(w0, c1, c2)
  ⊣ (if(w0, c3, c4)= c3 → c0 = c1)
  ⊣ (if(w0, c3, c4)= c4 → c0 = c2)
} = {
  pm2.61i(c0 = if(w0, c1, c2), w0)
  eqtr4d(c0, if(w0, c1, c2), c1, w0)
  syl(w0, c0 = c1, if(w0, c3, c4)= c3)
  iftrue(c3, c4, w0)
  iftrue(c1, c2, w0)
  eqtr4d(c0, if(w0, c1, c2), c2, ¬ w0)
  syl(¬ w0, c0 = c2, if(w0, c3, c4)= c4)
  iffalse(c3, c4, w0)
  iffalse(c1, c2, w0)
}

blocks.name: dfif3
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the conditional operator ~ df-if . Note that ` ph ` is independent of ` x ` i.e. a constant true or false. (Contributed by NM, 25-Aug-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfif3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wceq(cif(c0, c1, w0), cun(cin(c0, c2), cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))))
  -| wceq(c2, cab(s0, w0))
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  eqtr4i(cif(c0, c1, w0), cun(cin(c0, c2), cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))), cun(crab(hs0, c0, w0), crab(hs0, c1, wn(w0))))
  dfif6(hs0, c0, c1, w0)
  uneq12i(cin(c0, c2), cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2)), crab(hs0, c0, w0), crab(hs0, c1, wn(w0)))
  eqtr4i(cin(c0, c2), crab(hs0, c0, w0), cin(c0, cab(hs0, w0)))
  ineq2i(c0, c2, cab(hs0, w0))
  dfrab3(hs0, c0, w0)
  eqtr2i(cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2)), crab(hs0, c1, wn(w0)), cin(c1, cab(hs0, wn(w0))))
  dfrab3(hs0, c1, wn(w0))
  ineq2i(c1, cab(hs0, wn(w0)), cdif(universe, c2))
  eqtr4i(cab(hs0, wn(w0)), cdif(universe, c2), cdif(universe, cab(hs0, w0)))
  notab(hs0, w0)
  difeq2i(universe, c2, cab(hs0, w0))
  eqtri(c2, cab(hs0, w0), cab(s0, w0))
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, w0, w0)
  biidd(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm dfif3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ if(w0, c0, c1)=((c0 ⋂ c2)⋃(c1 ⋂(𝕌 \ c2)))
  ⊣ c2 = { s0 | w0 }
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  eqtr4i(if(w0, c0, c1), ((c0 ⋂ c2)⋃(c1 ⋂(𝕌 \ c2))), ({ hs0 ∈ c0 | w0 } ⋃ { hs0 ∈ c1 | ¬ w0 }))
  dfif6(hs0, c0, c1, w0)
  uneq12i((c0 ⋂ c2), (c1 ⋂(𝕌 \ c2)), { hs0 ∈ c0 | w0 }, { hs0 ∈ c1 | ¬ w0 })
  eqtr4i((c0 ⋂ c2), { hs0 ∈ c0 | w0 }, (c0 ⋂ { hs0 | w0 }))
  ineq2i(c0, c2, { hs0 | w0 })
  dfrab3(hs0, c0, w0)
  eqtr2i((c1 ⋂(𝕌 \ c2)), { hs0 ∈ c1 | ¬ w0 }, (c1 ⋂ { hs0 | ¬ w0 }))
  dfrab3(hs0, c1, ¬ w0)
  ineq2i(c1, { hs0 | ¬ w0 }, (𝕌 \ c2))
  eqtr4i({ hs0 | ¬ w0 }, (𝕌 \ c2), (𝕌 \ { hs0 | w0 }))
  notab(hs0, w0)
  difeq2i(universe, c2, { hs0 | w0 })
  eqtri(c2, { hs0 | w0 }, { s0 | w0 })
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, w0, w0)
  biidd(s0 = hs0, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: dfif4
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the conditional operator ~ df-if . Note that ` ph ` is independent of ` x ` i.e. a constant true or false. (Contributed by NM, 25-Aug-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfif4(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wceq(cif(c0, c1, w0), cin(cun(c0, c1), cin(cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2)), cun(c1, c2))))
  -| wceq(c2, cab(s0, w0))
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  3eqtri(cif(c0, c1, w0), cin(cun(c0, c1), cin(cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2)), cun(c1, c2))), cun(cin(c0, c2), cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))), cin(cun(c0, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))), cun(c2, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2)))))
  dfif3(s0, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  undir(c0, c2, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2)))
  eqtri(cin(cun(c0, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))), cun(c2, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2)))), cin(cun(c0, c1), cin(cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2)), cun(c1, c2))), cin(cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2))), cun(c1, c2)))
  ineq12i(cun(c0, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))), cun(c2, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))), cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2))), cun(c1, c2))
  undi(c0, c1, cdif(universe, c2))
  3eqtri(cun(c2, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))), cun(c1, c2), cin(cun(c2, c1), cun(c2, cdif(universe, c2))), cin(cun(c1, c2), universe))
  undi(c2, c1, cdif(universe, c2))
  ineq12i(cun(c2, c1), cun(c2, cdif(universe, c2)), cun(c1, c2), universe)
  uncom(c2, c1)
  unvdif(c2)
  inv1(cun(c1, c2))
  inass(cun(c0, c1), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2)), cun(c1, c2))
}

blocks.name: dfif5
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the conditional operator ~ df-if . Note that ` ph ` is independent of ` x ` i.e. a constant true or false (see also ~ ab0orv ). (Contributed by Gérard Lang, 18-Aug-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfif5(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wceq(cif(c0, c1, w0), cun(cin(c0, c1), cun(cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))))
  -| wceq(c2, cab(s0, w0))
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  3eqtr4i(cif(c0, c1, w0), cun(cin(c0, c1), cun(cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))), cin(cun(c0, c1), cin(cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2)), cun(c1, c2))), cin(cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2))), cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c1, c2))))
  inindi(cun(c0, c1), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2)), cun(c1, c2))
  dfif4(s0, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  eqtr4i(cun(cin(c0, c1), cun(cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))), cin(cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2))), cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c1, c2))), cin(cun(c0, cun(cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))), cun(c1, cun(cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2))))))
  undir(c0, c1, cun(cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2))))
  ineq12i(cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2))), cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c1, c2)), cun(c0, cun(cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))), cun(c1, cun(cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))))
  eqtr4i(cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2))), cun(c0, cun(cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))), cun(cun(c0, cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2)), cun(c0, cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))))
  eqtr4i(cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2))), cun(cun(c0, cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2)), cun(c0, cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))), cun(c0, cun(c0, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2)))))
  3eqtr3ri(cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2))), cun(c0, cun(c0, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2)))), cun(cun(c0, c0), cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))), cun(c0, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))))
  uneq1i(cun(c0, c0), cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2)), c0)
  unidm(c0)
  unass(c0, c0, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2)))
  uneq12i(cun(c0, cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2)), cun(c0, cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2))), c0, cun(c0, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))))
  3eqtri(cun(c0, cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2)), c0, cin(cun(c0, cdif(c0, c1)), cun(c0, c2)), cin(c0, cun(c0, c2)))
  undi(c0, cdif(c0, c1), c2)
  ineq1i(cun(c0, cdif(c0, c1)), cun(c0, c2), c0)
  undifabs(c0, c1)
  inabs(c0, c2)
  3eqtr4i(cun(c0, cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2))), cun(c0, cin(c1, cdif(universe, c2))), cin(cun(c0, cdif(c1, c0)), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2))), cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2))))
  ineq1i(cun(c0, cdif(c1, c0)), cun(c0, cdif(universe, c2)), cun(c0, c1))
  undif2(c0, c1)
  undi(c0, cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2))
  undi(c0, c1, cdif(universe, c2))
  unundi(c0, cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))
  3eqtr4i(cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c1, c2)), cun(c1, cun(cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))), cun(cin(c0, c2), c1), cun(cun(c1, cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2)), cun(c1, cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))))
  3eqtr3ri(cun(cin(c0, c2), c1), cun(cun(c1, cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2)), cun(c1, cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))), cun(cun(cin(c0, c2), c1), c1), cun(cin(c0, c2), cun(c1, c1)))
  unass(cin(c0, c2), c1, c1)
  uneq12i(cun(cin(c0, c2), c1), c1, cun(c1, cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2)), cun(c1, cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2))))
  eqtr4i(cun(cin(c0, c2), c1), cun(c1, cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2)), cin(cun(c1, cdif(c0, c1)), cun(c1, c2)))
  3eqtr4i(cun(cin(c0, c2), c1), cin(cun(c1, cdif(c0, c1)), cun(c1, c2)), cun(c1, cin(c0, c2)), cin(cun(c1, c0), cun(c1, c2)))
  undi(c1, c0, c2)
  uncom(cin(c0, c2), c1)
  ineq1i(cun(c1, cdif(c0, c1)), cun(c1, c2), cun(c1, c0))
  undif2(c1, c0)
  undi(c1, cdif(c0, c1), c2)
  3eqtrri(c1, cun(c1, cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2))), cin(cun(c1, cdif(c1, c0)), cun(c1, cdif(universe, c2))), cin(c1, cun(c1, cdif(universe, c2))))
  undi(c1, cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2))
  ineq1i(cun(c1, cdif(c1, c0)), cun(c1, cdif(universe, c2)), c1)
  undifabs(c1, c0)
  inabs(c1, cdif(universe, c2))
  uneq2i(cin(c0, c2), cun(c1, c1), c1)
  unidm(c1)
  eqtr4i(cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c1, c2)), cun(cin(c0, c2), c1), cin(cun(c0, c1), cun(c2, c1)))
  ineq2i(cun(c0, c1), cun(c1, c2), cun(c2, c1))
  uncom(c1, c2)
  undir(c0, c2, c1)
  unundi(c1, cin(cdif(c0, c1), c2), cin(cdif(c1, c0), cdif(universe, c2)))
}

blocks.name: ifbi
blocks.content: Equivalence theorem for conditional operators. (Contributed by Raph Levien, 15-Jan-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm ifbi(class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wb(w0, w1), wceq(cif(c0, c1, w0), cif(c0, c1, w1)))
} = {
  sylbi(wb(w0, w1), wceq(cif(c0, c1, w0), cif(c0, c1, w1)), wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), wn(w1))))
  dfbi3(w0, w1)
  jaoi(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), wn(w1)), wceq(cif(c0, c1, w0), cif(c0, c1, w1)))
  sylan9eq(cif(c0, c1, w0), cif(c0, c1, w1), c0, w0, w1)
  iftrue(c0, c1, w0)
  eqcomd(c0, cif(c0, c1, w1), w1)
  iftrue(c0, c1, w1)
  sylan9eq(cif(c0, c1, w0), cif(c0, c1, w1), c1, wn(w0), wn(w1))
  iffalse(c0, c1, w0)
  eqcomd(c1, cif(c0, c1, w1), wn(w1))
  iffalse(c0, c1, w1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ifbi(class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ ((w0 ↔ w1)→ if(w0, c0, c1)= if(w1, c0, c1))
} = {
  sylbi((w0 ↔ w1), if(w0, c0, c1)= if(w1, c0, c1), ((w0 ∧ w1)∨(¬ w0 ∧ ¬ w1)))
  dfbi3(w0, w1)
  jaoi((w0 ∧ w1), (¬ w0 ∧ ¬ w1), if(w0, c0, c1)= if(w1, c0, c1))
  sylan9eq(if(w0, c0, c1), if(w1, c0, c1), c0, w0, w1)
  iftrue(c0, c1, w0)
  eqcomd(c0, if(w1, c0, c1), w1)
  iftrue(c0, c1, w1)
  sylan9eq(if(w0, c0, c1), if(w1, c0, c1), c1, ¬ w0, ¬ w1)
  iffalse(c0, c1, w0)
  eqcomd(c1, if(w1, c0, c1), ¬ w1)
  iffalse(c0, c1, w1)
}

blocks.name: ifbid
blocks.content: Equivalence deduction for conditional operators. (Contributed by NM, 18-Apr-2005.)

blocks.name: ifbieq1d

blocks.name: nfifd
blocks.content: Deduction form of ~ nfif . (Contributed by NM, 15-Feb-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Oct-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm nfifd(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(w0, wnfc(s0, cif(c0, c1, w1)))
  -| wi(w0, wnf(s0, w1))
  -| wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c1))
} = {
  nfcxfrd(s0, cif(c0, c1, w1), cab(hs0, wi(wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), w1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), w1))), w0)
  dfif2(hs0, c0, c1, w1)
  nfabd(s0, hs0, w0, wi(wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), w1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), w1)))
  nfv(hs0, w0)
  nfimd(s0, w0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), w1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), w1))
  nfimd(s0, w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1), w1)
  nfcrd(s0, hs0, c1, w0)
  nfand(s0, w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0), w1)
  nfcrd(s0, hs0, c0, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(w1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm nfifd(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ (w0 → F/(s0, if(w1, c0, c1)))
  ⊣ (w0 → F/(s0, w1))
  ⊣ (w0 → F/(s0, c0))
  ⊣ (w0 → F/(s0, c1))
} = {
  nfcxfrd(s0, if(w1, c0, c1), { hs0 |((hs0 ∈ c1 → w1)→(hs0 ∈ c0 ∧ w1))}, w0)
  dfif2(hs0, c0, c1, w1)
  nfabd(s0, hs0, w0, ((hs0 ∈ c1 → w1)→(hs0 ∈ c0 ∧ w1)))
  nfv(hs0, w0)
  nfimd(s0, w0, (hs0 ∈ c1 → w1), (hs0 ∈ c0 ∧ w1))
  nfimd(s0, w0, hs0 ∈ c1, w1)
  nfcrd(s0, hs0, c1, w0)
  nfand(s0, w0, hs0 ∈ c0, w1)
  nfcrd(s0, hs0, c0, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(w1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: nfif
blocks.content: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for a conditional operator. (Contributed by NM, 16-Feb-2005.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 26-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: ifeq1da
blocks.content: Conditional equality. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)

blocks.name: ifeq2da

blocks.name: ifeq12da
blocks.content: Equivalence deduction for conditional operators. (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 24-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm ifeq12da(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cif(c0, c1, w1), cif(c2, c3, w1)))
  -| wi(wa(w0, w1), wceq(c0, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wn(w1)), wceq(c1, c3))
} = {
  pm2.61dan(w0, wceq(cif(c0, c1, w1), cif(c2, c3, w1)), w1)
  sylan9eq(cif(c0, c1, w1), cif(c2, c3, w1), cif(c2, c1, w1), w0, w1)
  ifeq1da(c0, c1, c2, w0, w1)
  eqtr4d(cif(c2, c1, w1), cif(c2, c3, w1), c2, w1)
  iftrue(c2, c1, w1)
  iftrue(c2, c3, w1)
  sylan9eq(cif(c0, c1, w1), cif(c2, c3, w1), cif(c0, c3, w1), w0, wn(w1))
  ifeq2da(c0, c1, c3, w0, w1)
  eqtr4d(cif(c0, c3, w1), cif(c2, c3, w1), c3, wn(w1))
  iffalse(c0, c3, w1)
  iffalse(c2, c3, w1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ifeq12da(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ (w0 → if(w1, c0, c1)= if(w1, c2, c3))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ w1)→ c0 = c2)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ ¬ w1)→ c1 = c3)
} = {
  pm2.61dan(w0, if(w1, c0, c1)= if(w1, c2, c3), w1)
  sylan9eq(if(w1, c0, c1), if(w1, c2, c3), if(w1, c2, c1), w0, w1)
  ifeq1da(c0, c1, c2, w0, w1)
  eqtr4d(if(w1, c2, c1), if(w1, c2, c3), c2, w1)
  iftrue(c2, c1, w1)
  iftrue(c2, c3, w1)
  sylan9eq(if(w1, c0, c1), if(w1, c2, c3), if(w1, c0, c3), w0, ¬ w1)
  ifeq2da(c0, c1, c3, w0, w1)
  eqtr4d(if(w1, c0, c3), if(w1, c2, c3), c3, ¬ w1)
  iffalse(c0, c3, w1)
  iffalse(c2, c3, w1)
}

blocks.name: ifbieq12d2
blocks.content: Equivalence deduction for conditional operators. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 14-Feb-2017.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 24-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: ifclda
blocks.content: Conditional closure. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)

blocks.name: ifeqda
blocks.content: Separation of the values of the conditional operator. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 13-Apr-2018.)

blocks.name: elimif
blocks.content: Elimination of a conditional operator contained in a wff ` ps ` . (Contributed by NM, 15-Feb-2005.) (Proof shortened by NM, 25-Apr-2019.)

blocks.name: ifbothda
blocks.content: A wff ` th ` containing a conditional operator is true when both of its cases are true. (Contributed by NM, 15-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ifbothda(class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(w0, w1)
  -| wi(wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w2)), wb(w3, w1))
  -| wi(wceq(c1, cif(c0, c1, w2)), wb(w4, w1))
  -| wi(wa(w0, w2), w3)
  -| wi(wa(w0, wn(w2)), w4)
} = {
  pm2.61dan(w0, w1, w2)
  mpbid(wa(w0, w2), w1, w3)
  adantl(w0, w2, wb(w3, w1))
  syl(w2, wb(w3, w1), wceq(c0, cif(c0, c1, w2)))
  eqcomd(c0, cif(c0, c1, w2), w2)
  iftrue(c0, c1, w2)
  mpbid(wa(w0, wn(w2)), w1, w4)
  adantl(w0, wn(w2), wb(w4, w1))
  syl(wn(w2), wb(w4, w1), wceq(c1, cif(c0, c1, w2)))
  eqcomd(c1, cif(c0, c1, w2), wn(w2))
  iffalse(c0, c1, w2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ifbothda(class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  ⊢ (w0 → w1)
  ⊣ (c0 = if(w2, c0, c1)→(w3 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ (c1 = if(w2, c0, c1)→(w4 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ w2)→ w3)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ ¬ w2)→ w4)
} = {
  pm2.61dan(w0, w1, w2)
  mpbid((w0 ∧ w2), w1, w3)
  adantl(w0, w2, (w3 ↔ w1))
  syl(w2, (w3 ↔ w1), c0 = if(w2, c0, c1))
  eqcomd(c0, if(w2, c0, c1), w2)
  iftrue(c0, c1, w2)
  mpbid((w0 ∧ ¬ w2), w1, w4)
  adantl(w0, ¬ w2, (w4 ↔ w1))
  syl(¬ w2, (w4 ↔ w1), c1 = if(w2, c0, c1))
  eqcomd(c1, if(w2, c0, c1), ¬ w2)
  iffalse(c0, c1, w2)
}

blocks.name: ifboth
blocks.content: A wff ` th ` containing a conditional operator is true when both of its cases are true. (Contributed by NM, 3-Sep-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: ifid
blocks.content: Identical true and false arguments in the conditional operator. (Contributed by NM, 18-Apr-2005.)

blocks.name: eqif
blocks.content: Expansion of an equality with a conditional operator. (Contributed by NM, 14-Feb-2005.)

blocks.name: ifval
blocks.content: Another expression of the value of the ` if ` predicate, analogous to ~ eqif . See also the more specialized ~ iftrue and ~ iffalse . (Contributed by BJ, 6-Apr-2019.)

blocks.name: elif
blocks.content: Membership in a conditional operator. (Contributed by NM, 14-Feb-2005.)

blocks.name: ifel
blocks.content: Membership of a conditional operator. (Contributed by NM, 10-Sep-2005.)

blocks.name: ifcl
blocks.content: Membership (closure) of a conditional operator. (Contributed by NM, 4-Apr-2005.)

blocks.name: ifcld
blocks.content: Membership (closure) of a conditional operator, deduction form. (Contributed by SO, 16-Jul-2018.)

blocks.name: ifcli
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ ifcl . Membership (closure) of a conditional operator. Also usable to keep a membership hypothesis for the weak deduction theorem ~ dedth when the special case ` B e. C ` is provable. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-1999.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 1-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: ifexg
blocks.content: Conditional operator existence. (Contributed by NM, 21-Mar-2011.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 1-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: ifex
blocks.content: Conditional operator existence. (Contributed by NM, 2-Sep-2004.)

blocks.name: ifeqor
blocks.content: The possible values of a conditional operator. (Contributed by NM, 17-Jun-2007.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 26-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: ifnot
blocks.content: Negating the first argument swaps the last two arguments of a conditional operator. (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-2007.)

blocks.name: ifan
blocks.content: Rewrite a conjunction in a conditional as two nested conditionals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Jul-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm ifan(class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wceq(cif(c0, c1, wa(w0, w1)), cif(cif(c0, c1, w1), c1, w0))
} = {
  pm2.61i(wceq(cif(c0, c1, wa(w0, w1)), cif(cif(c0, c1, w1), c1, w0)), w0)
  eqtr2d(cif(c0, c1, wa(w0, w1)), cif(cif(c0, c1, w1), c1, w0), cif(c0, c1, w1), w0)
  iftrue(cif(c0, c1, w1), c1, w0)
  ifbid(c0, c1, w0, w1, wa(w0, w1))
  ibar(w0, w1)
  eqtr4d(cif(c0, c1, wa(w0, w1)), cif(cif(c0, c1, w1), c1, w0), c1, wn(w0))
  iffalsed(c0, c1, wn(w0), wa(w0, w1))
  con3i(w0, wa(w0, w1))
  simpl(w0, w1)
  iffalse(cif(c0, c1, w1), c1, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ifan(class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ if((w0 ∧ w1), c0, c1)= if(w0, if(w1, c0, c1), c1)
} = {
  pm2.61i(if((w0 ∧ w1), c0, c1)= if(w0, if(w1, c0, c1), c1), w0)
  eqtr2d(if((w0 ∧ w1), c0, c1), if(w0, if(w1, c0, c1), c1), if(w1, c0, c1), w0)
  iftrue(if(w1, c0, c1), c1, w0)
  ifbid(c0, c1, w0, w1, (w0 ∧ w1))
  ibar(w0, w1)
  eqtr4d(if((w0 ∧ w1), c0, c1), if(w0, if(w1, c0, c1), c1), c1, ¬ w0)
  iffalsed(c0, c1, ¬ w0, (w0 ∧ w1))
  con3i(w0, (w0 ∧ w1))
  simpl(w0, w1)
  iffalse(if(w1, c0, c1), c1, w0)
}

blocks.name: ifor
blocks.content: Rewrite a disjunction in a conditional as two nested conditionals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Jul-2014.)

blocks.name: 2if2
blocks.content: Resolve two nested conditionals. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 27-Mar-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2if2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, w2), w1)))
  -| wi(wa(w0, w1), wceq(c0, c1))
  -| wi(w3a(w0, wn(w1), w2), wceq(c0, c2))
  -| wi(w3a(w0, wn(w1), wn(w2)), wceq(c0, c3))
} = {
  pm2.61dan(w0, wceq(c0, cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, w2), w1)), w1)
  eqtr4d(c0, cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, w2), w1), c1, wa(w0, w1))
  adantl(w0, w1, wceq(cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, w2), w1), c1))
  iftrue(c1, cif(c2, c3, w2), w1)
  eqtr4d(c0, cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, w2), w1), cif(c2, c3, w2), wa(w0, wn(w1)))
  pm2.61dan(wa(w0, wn(w1)), wceq(c0, cif(c2, c3, w2)), w2)
  eqtr4d(c0, cif(c2, c3, w2), c2, wa(wa(w0, wn(w1)), w2))
  3expa(w0, wn(w1), w2, wceq(c0, c2))
  adantl(wa(w0, wn(w1)), w2, wceq(cif(c2, c3, w2), c2))
  iftrue(c2, c3, w2)
  eqtrd(c0, cif(c2, c3, w2), c3, wa(wa(w0, wn(w1)), wn(w2)))
  3expa(w0, wn(w1), wn(w2), wceq(c0, c3))
  adantl(wa(w0, wn(w1)), wn(w2), wceq(c3, cif(c2, c3, w2)))
  eqcomd(c3, cif(c2, c3, w2), wn(w2))
  iffalse(c2, c3, w2)
  adantl(w0, wn(w1), wceq(cif(c1, cif(c2, c3, w2), w1), cif(c2, c3, w2)))
  iffalse(c1, cif(c2, c3, w2), w1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm 2if2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 = if(w1, c1, if(w2, c2, c3)))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ w1)→ c0 = c1)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ ¬ w1 ∧ w2)→ c0 = c2)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ ¬ w1 ∧ ¬ w2)→ c0 = c3)
} = {
  pm2.61dan(w0, c0 = if(w1, c1, if(w2, c2, c3)), w1)
  eqtr4d(c0, if(w1, c1, if(w2, c2, c3)), c1, (w0 ∧ w1))
  adantl(w0, w1, if(w1, c1, if(w2, c2, c3))= c1)
  iftrue(c1, if(w2, c2, c3), w1)
  eqtr4d(c0, if(w1, c1, if(w2, c2, c3)), if(w2, c2, c3), (w0 ∧ ¬ w1))
  pm2.61dan((w0 ∧ ¬ w1), c0 = if(w2, c2, c3), w2)
  eqtr4d(c0, if(w2, c2, c3), c2, ((w0 ∧ ¬ w1)∧ w2))
  3expa(w0, ¬ w1, w2, c0 = c2)
  adantl((w0 ∧ ¬ w1), w2, if(w2, c2, c3)= c2)
  iftrue(c2, c3, w2)
  eqtrd(c0, if(w2, c2, c3), c3, ((w0 ∧ ¬ w1)∧ ¬ w2))
  3expa(w0, ¬ w1, ¬ w2, c0 = c3)
  adantl((w0 ∧ ¬ w1), ¬ w2, c3 = if(w2, c2, c3))
  eqcomd(c3, if(w2, c2, c3), ¬ w2)
  iffalse(c2, c3, w2)
  adantl(w0, ¬ w1, if(w1, c1, if(w2, c2, c3))= if(w2, c2, c3))
  iffalse(c1, if(w2, c2, c3), w1)
}

blocks.name: ifcomnan
blocks.content: Commute the conditions in two nested conditionals if both conditions are not simultaneously true. (Contributed by SO, 15-Jul-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm ifcomnan(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wn(wa(w0, w1)), wceq(cif(c0, cif(c1, c2, w1), w0), cif(c1, cif(c0, c2, w0), w1)))
} = {
  syl(wn(wa(w0, w1)), wceq(cif(c0, cif(c1, c2, w1), w0), cif(c1, cif(c0, c2, w0), w1)), wo(wn(w0), wn(w1)))
  pm3.13(w0, w1)
  jaoi(wn(w0), wn(w1), wceq(cif(c0, cif(c1, c2, w1), w0), cif(c1, cif(c0, c2, w0), w1)))
  eqtr4d(cif(c0, cif(c1, c2, w1), w0), cif(c1, cif(c0, c2, w0), w1), cif(c1, c2, w1), wn(w0))
  iffalse(c0, cif(c1, c2, w1), w0)
  ifeq2d(c1, cif(c0, c2, w0), c2, wn(w0), w1)
  iffalse(c0, c2, w0)
  eqtr4d(cif(c0, cif(c1, c2, w1), w0), cif(c1, cif(c0, c2, w0), w1), cif(c0, c2, w0), wn(w1))
  ifeq2d(c0, cif(c1, c2, w1), c2, wn(w1), w0)
  iffalse(c1, c2, w1)
  iffalse(c1, cif(c0, c2, w0), w1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ifcomnan(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ (¬(w0 ∧ w1)→ if(w0, c0, if(w1, c1, c2))= if(w1, c1, if(w0, c0, c2)))
} = {
  syl(¬(w0 ∧ w1), if(w0, c0, if(w1, c1, c2))= if(w1, c1, if(w0, c0, c2)), (¬ w0 ∨ ¬ w1))
  pm3.13(w0, w1)
  jaoi(¬ w0, ¬ w1, if(w0, c0, if(w1, c1, c2))= if(w1, c1, if(w0, c0, c2)))
  eqtr4d(if(w0, c0, if(w1, c1, c2)), if(w1, c1, if(w0, c0, c2)), if(w1, c1, c2), ¬ w0)
  iffalse(c0, if(w1, c1, c2), w0)
  ifeq2d(c1, if(w0, c0, c2), c2, ¬ w0, w1)
  iffalse(c0, c2, w0)
  eqtr4d(if(w0, c0, if(w1, c1, c2)), if(w1, c1, if(w0, c0, c2)), if(w0, c0, c2), ¬ w1)
  ifeq2d(c0, if(w1, c1, c2), c2, ¬ w1, w0)
  iffalse(c1, c2, w1)
  iffalse(c1, if(w0, c0, c2), w1)
}

blocks.name: csbif
blocks.content: Distribute proper substitution through the conditional operator. (Contributed by NM, 24-Feb-2013.) (Revised by NM, 19-Aug-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm csbif(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wceq(csb(s0, c0, cif(c1, c2, w0)), cif(csb(s0, c0, c1), csb(s0, c0, c2), wsbc(s0, c0, w0)))
} = {
  pm2.61i(wceq(csb(s0, c0, cif(c1, c2, w0)), cif(csb(s0, c0, c1), csb(s0, c0, c2), wsbc(s0, c0, w0))), wcel(c0, universe))
  vtoclg(hs0, c0, universe, wceq(csb(s0, c0, cif(c1, c2, w0)), cif(csb(s0, c0, c1), csb(s0, c0, c2), wsbc(s0, c0, w0))), wceq(csb(s0, cv(hs0), cif(c1, c2, w0)), cif(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), wsb(hs0, s0, w0))))
  eqeq12d(csb(s0, cv(hs0), cif(c1, c2, w0)), cif(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), wsb(hs0, s0, w0)), csb(s0, c0, cif(c1, c2, w0)), cif(csb(s0, c0, c1), csb(s0, c0, c2), wsbc(s0, c0, w0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  csbeq1(s0, cv(hs0), c0, cif(c1, c2, w0))
  ifbieq12d(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, c0, c1), csb(s0, c0, c2), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wsb(hs0, s0, w0), wsbc(s0, c0, w0))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  csbeq1(s0, cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  csbeq1(s0, cv(hs0), c0, c2)
  csbief(s0, cv(hs0), cif(c1, c2, w0), cif(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), wsb(hs0, s0, w0)))
  vex(hs0)
  nfif(s0, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), wsb(hs0, s0, w0))
  nfs1v(s0, hs0, w0)
  nfcsb1v(s0, cv(hs0), c1)
  nfcsb1v(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  ifbieq12d(c1, c2, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), w0, wsb(hs0, s0, w0))
  sbequ12(s0, hs0, w0)
  csbeq1a(s0, cv(hs0), c1)
  csbeq1a(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  eqtrd(csb(s0, c0, cif(c1, c2, w0)), cif(csb(s0, c0, c1), csb(s0, c0, c2), wsbc(s0, c0, w0)), emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  csbprc(s0, c0, cif(c1, c2, w0))
  syl6req(emptycls, cif(csb(s0, c0, c1), csb(s0, c0, c2), wsbc(s0, c0, w0)), cif(emptycls, emptycls, wsbc(s0, c0, w0)), wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  ifeq12d(csb(s0, c0, c1), csb(s0, c0, c2), emptycls, emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wsbc(s0, c0, w0))
  csbprc(s0, c0, c1)
  csbprc(s0, c0, c2)
  ifid(emptycls, wsbc(s0, c0, w0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(csb(s0, c0, cif(c1, c2, w0)), cif(csb(s0, c0, c1), csb(s0, c0, c2), wsbc(s0, c0, w0))))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm csbif(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ [c0 / s0]if(w0, c1, c2)= if([c0 / s0]w0,[c0 / s0]c1,[c0 / s0]c2)
} = {
  pm2.61i([c0 / s0]if(w0, c1, c2)= if([c0 / s0]w0,[c0 / s0]c1,[c0 / s0]c2), c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  vtoclg(hs0, c0, universe, [c0 / s0]if(w0, c1, c2)= if([c0 / s0]w0,[c0 / s0]c1,[c0 / s0]c2), [hs0 / s0]if(w0, c1, c2)= if([hs0 / s0]w0,[hs0 / s0]c1,[hs0 / s0]c2))
  eqeq12d([hs0 / s0]if(w0, c1, c2), if([hs0 / s0]w0,[hs0 / s0]c1,[hs0 / s0]c2), [c0 / s0]if(w0, c1, c2), if([c0 / s0]w0,[c0 / s0]c1,[c0 / s0]c2), hs0 = c0)
  csbeq1(s0, hs0, c0, if(w0, c1, c2))
  ifbieq12d([hs0 / s0]c1, [hs0 / s0]c2, [c0 / s0]c1, [c0 / s0]c2, hs0 = c0, [hs0 / s0]w0, [c0 / s0]w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, c0, w0)
  csbeq1(s0, hs0, c0, c1)
  csbeq1(s0, hs0, c0, c2)
  csbief(s0, hs0, if(w0, c1, c2), if([hs0 / s0]w0,[hs0 / s0]c1,[hs0 / s0]c2))
  vex(hs0)
  nfif(s0, [hs0 / s0]c1, [hs0 / s0]c2, [hs0 / s0]w0)
  nfs1v(s0, hs0, w0)
  nfcsb1v(s0, hs0, c1)
  nfcsb1v(s0, hs0, c2)
  ifbieq12d(c1, c2, [hs0 / s0]c1, [hs0 / s0]c2, s0 = hs0, w0, [hs0 / s0]w0)
  sbequ12(s0, hs0, w0)
  csbeq1a(s0, hs0, c1)
  csbeq1a(s0, hs0, c2)
  eqtrd([c0 / s0]if(w0, c1, c2), if([c0 / s0]w0,[c0 / s0]c1,[c0 / s0]c2), emptycls, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  csbprc(s0, c0, if(w0, c1, c2))
  syl6req(emptycls, if([c0 / s0]w0,[c0 / s0]c1,[c0 / s0]c2), if([c0 / s0]w0, ∅, ∅), ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  ifeq12d([c0 / s0]c1, [c0 / s0]c2, emptycls, emptycls, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌, [c0 / s0]w0)
  csbprc(s0, c0, c1)
  csbprc(s0, c0, c2)
  ifid(emptycls, [c0 / s0]w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w([c0 / s0]if(w0, c1, c2)= if([c0 / s0]w0,[c0 / s0]c1,[c0 / s0]c2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
